item.title: [RBX2A][PCC Datastore] - Cluster8576
item.description:
Feb 14, 00:24 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 13/02/2022 23:07 UTC
End Time : 13/02/2022 23:30 UTC
Service impact : Datastore now functional
Root cause :Software failure during switch service between node

Feb 14, 00:02 UTC
Investigating - Please note the incident on

Following all the necessary information.

Start time: 13/02/2022 23:07 UTC
User impact :Datastore unavailable: ssd-011725 , ssd-11726, ssd-011639, ssd-011637, ssd-011642
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) :RBX2A
Scope of impact :Part of customers of Cluster 8576 (Datastore listed)
Ongoin Actions:An intervention is in progress
Root cause:Software failure during switch service between node
Time resolution : 13/02/2022 23:30 UTC

Thank you for your understanding

OVHcloud Technical team

item.title: [RBX2][Storage] - tete-496
item.description:
Jan 30, 03:24 UTC
Resolved - Resolved: The migration of virtual machines went well. The virtual machines administration services are up now since 02:30 UTC.

Jan 30, 00:06 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: The slave spare went well, we are testing the performance, we will come back to you to give you a new update as soon as possible. Thank you for your understanding.

Jan 29, 22:23 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: Our technical teams will carry out an intervention to spare the slave head. During the intervention the virtual machines will be unavailable. The intervention will last about 1 hour.

Jan 29, 19:58 UTC
Identified - Start time: 29/01/2022 18:06 UTC
User impact : Administration VMs ( vcenter, vcsa, pcc master rbx2a, nsx, gw) are unreachable
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2a
Scope of impact : The impacted pool is pcc-003516.
Root cause : Hardware issue.
Ongoin Actions: Our teams are currently working to solve the issue.
We apologize for the inconvenience caused.

Jan 29, 19:10 UTC
Investigating - Please note the incident on vcenter/vcsa/pcc master rbx2a/nsx/gw

Following all the necessary information.

Start time: 29/01/2022 18:06 UTC
User impact : Administration VMs ( vcenter, vcsa, pcc master rbx2a, nsx, gw) are unreachable
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2a
Scope of impact : The impacted pool is pcc-003516.
Ongoin Actions: Our teams are currently cheking the storage of the servers.
We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your understanding.

Thank you for your understanding

OVHcloud Technical team

item.title: [RBX2][Storage] - tete-165/tete-171/tete-172/tete-125
item.description:
Jan 26, 01:53 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 25/01/2022 21:15 UTC
End Time : 26/01/2022 01:22 UTC
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2a
Root cause : A network equipment has failed

Jan 25, 23:40 UTC
Update - User impact : Some PCC storage on tete-165, tete-171, tete-125 are unreachable.
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2a
Ongoing Actions: The service has returned for the tete-172 :
pcc-002955
pcc-002956
pcc-002944
pcc-002493
pcc-003575
pcc-002424

Here is the list of pools still impacted:
tete-165
pcc-002136
pcc-000713
pcc-003211
pcc-000714
pcc-000719
pcc-000717
pcc-000724

tete-171
pcc-000504
pcc-003197

tete-125
pcc-001351

Jan 25, 23:22 UTC
Identified - Update : A network equipment has failed on this rack which caused an outage for the mentioned storage nodes and datasets. While High Availability was activated on all clusters of this rack, 4 of the clusters failed to switch on the failover node because of different and individual physical problems.
We are currently working on restoring the availability of these storage datasets as soon as possible.
We will keep you updated.

Jan 25, 21:54 UTC
Investigating - Please note the incident on PCC Storage.

Following all the necessary information.

Start time: 25/01/2022 21:15 UTC
User impact : Some PCC storage on tete-165, tete-171, tete-172, tete-125 are unreachable.
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2a
Ongoing Actions: Our teams are in the process of doing what is necessary to correct the incident as soon as possible.

Thank you for your understanding

OVHcloud Technical team
